com.google.code.sagetvaddons.sjq.network
Class ServerClient

java.lang.Object
  com.google.code.sagetvaddons.sjq.listener.ListenerClient
      com.google.code.sagetvaddons.sjq.network.ServerClient

public final class ServerClient
extends com.google.code.sagetvaddons.sjq.listener.ListenerClient

Provides synchronized access to the task queue across JVMs via sockets

Version:
$Id: ServerClient.java 1295 2010-11-19 05:03:39Z derek@battams.ca $
Author:
dbattams

Constructor Detail

ServerClient

public ServerClient(java.lang.String logPkg)
             throws java.io.IOException

Constructor; will connect to the SJQ server running on the SageTV server this app is associated with

If called outside the Sage JVM then it is expected that the sagex-api RMI provider has been properly configured before calling this constructor

Parameters:
logPkg - The package name of the caller; ensures logs end up in the right log file; should be com.google.code.sagetvaddons.sjq.server OR com.google.code.sagetvaddons.sjq.agent
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If there was an error making the socket connection to the SJQ server

public ServerClient()
             throws java.io.IOException
Throws:
java.io.IOException

isEngineAlive

public static final boolean isEngineAlive()
Test to see if the SJQv4 engine is alive and running

Returns:
True if it is or false otherwise

addTask

public long addTask(java.lang.String taskId,
                    java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> env)
             throws java.io.IOException
Add a new task to the task queue

Parameters:
taskId - The task id to be added
env - The map of env vars to be attached to the task's runtime env; can be empty, but not null
Returns:
The task queue id assigned to the newly inserted task
Throws:
java.io.IOException - Thrown if there was an error adding the task to the task queue

deleteTask

public boolean deleteTask(long queueId)
                   throws java.io.IOException
Delete a task from the task queue

Parameters:
queueId - The unique task queue id number to be deleted
Returns:
True if the task was deleted or false otherwise; only tasks in WAITING, RETURNED, or FAILED state can be deleted, any other state will cause false to be returned
Throws:
java.io.IOException - Thrown if there were fatal errors with the network connection to the SJQ engine socket

deleteClient

public boolean deleteClient(Client clnt)
                     throws java.io.IOException
Delete a registered task client

Parameters:
clnt - The client to be deleted
Returns:
True on success or false otherwise; you cannot delete a task client if it is currently running tasks, false will be returned if you try to do so
Throws:
java.io.IOException - In case of communication errors with the server

getActiveQueue

public QueuedTask[] getActiveQueue()
Get the list of active tasks in the queue; a task is active if it's in WAITING, RETURNED or RUNNING state

Returns:
The array of active tasks; can be empty in case of error, but never null

getAllClients

public Client[] getAllClients()
Get all the registered clients

Returns:
The array of registered task clients

getClient

public Client getClient(java.lang.String host,
                        int port)
Get a client by host/port

Parameters:
host - The hostname of the client to get
port - The port the client is listening on
Returns:
The Client or null if the client is not registered

saveClient

public boolean saveClient(Client clnt)
Register a new task client or update an existing client

Parameters:
clnt - The client to register/update
Returns:
True if the registration/update succeeded or false otherwise

getRegisteredTaskIds

public java.lang.String[] getRegisteredTaskIds()
Get the list of all registered task ids

Returns:
The array of all registered task ids, may be empty in case of error but never null

killTask

public boolean killTask(QueuedTask qt)
                 throws java.io.IOException
Kill the given task on the task agent that is running it

Parameters:
qt - The task to be killed
Returns:
True if the signal was sent successfully or false otherwise; this is an asynchronous command, the return value does not represent if a task was actually killed only if the signal to kill was successfully sent
Throws:
java.io.IOException - In case of network comm issues

killAllTasks

public boolean killAllTasks(Client clnt)
                     throws java.io.IOException
Kill all running tasks on the given task client

Parameters:
clnt - The task client to kill all active tasks on
Returns:
True on successful request, false otherwise; this is an asynchronous command so the return value does not signify if any tasks were actually killed
Throws:
java.io.IOException - In case of network comm errors

pingTaskClient

public Client pingTaskClient(Client clnt)
                      throws java.io.IOException
Request the server pings the given client and updates its status

Parameters:
clnt - The Client to be pinged by the server
Returns:
The updated Client or null in case of error (i.e. the client did not respond to the ping)
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If there are network comm errors

readCrontab

public java.util.List<java.lang.String> readCrontab()
                                             throws java.io.IOException
Read the crontab file from the SJQ server

Returns:
The contents of the crontab file, as a List with each element representing a line from the file; the List will include comment and blank lines from the file
Throws:
java.io.IOException - In case of network errors

scheduleMediaScan

public void scheduleMediaScan()
                       throws java.io.IOException
Schedule a delayed media scan on the SageTV server; the scan will happen within ~20 minutes; subsequent calls to this command within that 20 minute window are simply ignored. Use this instead of Global.RunLibraryImportScan() to prevent generating a bunch of simultaneous scanning threads on the SageTV server.

Throws:
java.io.IOException - In case of network errors

writeCrontab

public boolean writeCrontab(java.util.List<java.lang.String> data)
                     throws java.io.IOException
Save the given String as the new crontab file on the SJQ server

Parameters:
data - The new contents of the crontab file
Returns:
True on success or false otherwise
Throws:
java.io.IOException - In case of network errors

getMetadataForTask

public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getMetadataForTask(QueuedTask qt)
Return the metadata map associated with the given QueuedTask

Parameters:
qt - The task to get metadata for
Returns:
The task's metadata. An empty map is returned if the task has no metadata.

getAllRegisteredTasks

public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.Collection<Task>> getAllRegisteredTasks()
Get a map of all registered tasks; the keys of the map are the task client the task is registered to

Returns:
The map of registered tasks, keyed by Client.getDescription()

getTaskLog

public java.lang.String getTaskLog(long qId,
                                   QueuedTask.OutputType type)
Get the task output for the given queue id and type

Parameters:
qId - The queue id to retrieve task output for
type - The type of task output to retrieve
Returns:
The retrieved task output or the empty string in case of error

getTaskLog

public java.lang.String getTaskLog(long qId,
                                   java.lang.String type)
Convenience method for STVi access to specific log types

Parameters:
qId - The queue id to read logs for
type - The type of logs, must be one of the valid values of the QueuedTask.OutputType enum
Returns:
The requested logs, as a String, or the empty string in case of error

getTaskLog

public java.lang.String getTaskLog(long qId)
Get all task output for the given queue id

Parameters:
qId - The queue id to get the task output for
Returns:
All task output for the given queue id or the empty string in case of error

addTaskToEvent

public void addTaskToEvent(java.lang.String taskId,
                           java.lang.String eventId)
Attach a task to an event; the event should be one of the supported engine events, but it's not enforced

Parameters:
taskId - The task id to attach to the given event
eventId - The event id the given task is being attached to
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - If either argument is null

addTasksToEvent

public void addTasksToEvent(java.lang.String[] taskIds,
                            java.lang.String eventId)
Attach an array of task ids to the given event id; the event should be one of the supported engine events, but it's not enforced

Parameters:
taskIds - An array of task ids to be attached to the given event id
eventId - The event id the given tasks are to be attached to
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - If either argument is null

addTasksToEvent

public void addTasksToEvent(java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> taskIds,
                            java.lang.String eventId)
Attach a Collection of task ids to the given event id; the event should be one of the supported engine events, but it's not enforced

Parameters:
taskIds - The collection of task ids to attach to the given event id
eventId - The event id the given tasks are to be attached to
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - If either argument is null

                                java.lang.String eventId)

taskId - The task id to be removed
